rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/7af4c236-5148-4d3d-815c-b6451aee67a5">     <title>High resolution nutrient chemistry of the River Frome, Dorset, UK (2004-2006)</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/7af4c236-5148-4d3d-815c-b6451aee67a5</link>     <description>This data resource consists of a nutrient concentration time series for the River Frome at East Stoke, Dorset, gathered between January 2004 and February 2006.  Total phosphorus concentration data was gathered for the full duration of the project. Soluble reactive phosphorus, total oxidisable nitrogen and dissolved reactive silicon concentration was only gathered from Jan 2005 until Feb 2006.  Sampling interval varied throughout the monitoring period, from a minimum of two samples to day, to eight per day during storm events (with an average of three samples per day throughout the duration of the monitoring period).  Samples were taken from the main flow of the river using an automatic water sampler, and analysed using standard colorometric methods, at the CEH Dorset laboratories. Further details of the field and laboratory procedures are outlined in Bowes MJ, Smith JT, Neal C. The value of high resolution nutrient monitoring: a case study of the River Frome, Dorset, UK. Journal of Hydrology 2009; 378: 82-96.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Nuria Bachiller-Jareno</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Chemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Nutrient</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Eutrophication</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Hysteresis</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>River load estimates</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Chalk river</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>East Stoke</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Wareham</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Dorset</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>UK</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>River Frome</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>River</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Water</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>2004 - 2006</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>3 samples per day</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Project C02405</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2015-03-16T14:56:27Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/4b255fc4-33d3-4beb-a238-37e1a8cf32a2">     <title>Windermere pike fecundity and egg data 1963-2003</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/4b255fc4-33d3-4beb-a238-37e1a8cf32a2</link>     <description>This dataset consists of fecundity, egg and associated data on female pike (Esox lucius) from net sampling in Windermere. Data collection began in 1963. The data were initially collected by the Freshwater Biological Association (FBA) but have been collected by the Centre for Ecology and Hydrology and its predecessor Institute of Freshwater Ecology (IFE) since 1989.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Claire Wood</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Windermere</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>fish</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Water resources</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2015-03-16T09:25:36Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/85dc93d2-8c29-4660-b725-793e43703e46">     <title>Perch weekly catches from Green Tuft 1946-2012</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/85dc93d2-8c29-4660-b725-793e43703e46</link>     <description>This dataset consists of total weekly catch data of mature Perch (Perca fluviatilis) from trapping at Green Tuft, Windermere, Cumbria, sampled between 1946 and 2012.  Perch have been monitored in the north and south basins of Windermere by trapping with variations in sampling sites and efforts from 1943 to the present.  The data were initially collected by the Freshwater Biological Association (FBA) but have been collected by the Centre for Ecology & Hydrology (CEH) and its predecessor Institute of Freshwater Ecology (IFE) since 1989.  </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Claire Wood</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>water</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>monthly</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Lake District</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>fish</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>perch</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2014-08-14T11:16:37Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/453fdf49-7328-42ec-94b7-1cebf06c51e2">     <title>Windermere monthly temperatures 1946-2012</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/453fdf49-7328-42ec-94b7-1cebf06c51e2</link>     <description>This dataset consists of monthly mean inshore surface water temperature (degrees C) data from Windermere, a lake in northern England. Data collection began in 1933, but data are presented here from 1946 onwards. The data were initially collected by the Freshwater Biological Association (FBA), then by CEH and its predecessor Institute of Freshwater Ecology (IFE) from 1989 to 2003, and subsequently again by FBA.     </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Claire Wood</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>water</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Lake District</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>monthly</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2014-08-14T10:55:02Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/495fd597-42b2-4985-96dc-3d9ec024b829">     <title>Perch weekly mean sizes from Green Tuft 1946-2012</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/495fd597-42b2-4985-96dc-3d9ec024b829</link>     <description>This dataset consists of weekly mean sizes of Perch (Perca fluviatilis) from trapping at Green Tuft, Windermere, Cumbria, sampled between 1946 and 2012.  Perch have been monitored in the north and south basins of Windermere by trapping with variations in sampling sites and efforts from 1943 to the present.  The data were initially collected by the Freshwater Biological Association (FBA) but have been collected by the Centre for Ecology & Hydrology (CEH) and its predecessor Institute of Freshwater Ecology (IFE) since 1989.   </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Claire Wood</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>water</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Lake District</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>monthly</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>fish</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>perch</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2014-08-14T10:44:36Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/58357e70-d79b-4149-aa02-762c20b01198">     <title>Pike 1944-2002</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/58357e70-d79b-4149-aa02-762c20b01198</link>     <description>This series of datasets consists of growth (length) data, survival data and fecundity data for Pike (Esox lucius) from net sampling in Windermere. Lake temperature data is also part of the series.  Data collection began in 1944. The data were initially collected by the Freshwater Biological Association (FBA) but have been collected by CEH and its predecessor Institute of Freshwater Ecology (IFE) since 1989.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Hannah Dean</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Windermere</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-09-16T14:34:30Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/9520664c-eb4d-4700-b064-5d215d23e595">     <title>Windermere lake temperature data 1944-2002</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/9520664c-eb4d-4700-b064-5d215d23e595</link>     <description>This dataset consists of inshore surface water temperature (degrees C) data on Windermere. Data collection began in 1933, but it presented here from 1944 onwards. The data were initially collected by the Freshwater Biological Association (FBA), then by CEH and its predecessor Institute of Freshwater Ecology (IFE) from 1989 to 2003, and subsequently again by FBA.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Claire Wood</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Windermere</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-09-09T14:31:03Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/813e07dd-2135-49bc-93c6-83999e442b36">     <title>Pike survival data 1953-1990</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/813e07dd-2135-49bc-93c6-83999e442b36</link>     <description>This dataset consists of survival (binary) data derived from capture-mark-recapture on Pike (Esox lucius) from net and angling sampling in Windermere. Data collection began in 1944. The data were initially collected by the Freshwater Biological Association (FBA) but have been collected by CEH and its predecessor Institute of Freshwater Ecology (IFE) since 1989.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Claire Wood</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Windermere</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-09-09T14:29:14Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/637d60d6-1571-49af-93f7-24c1279d884d">     <title>Pike growth data 1944-1995</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/637d60d6-1571-49af-93f7-24c1279d884d</link>     <description>This dataset consists of growth (length) data on Pike (Esox lucius) from net sampling in Windermere. Data collection began in 1944. The data were initially collected by the Freshwater Biological Association (FBA) but have been collected by CEH and its predecessor Institute of Freshwater Ecology (IFE) since 1989.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Claire Wood</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Windermere</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-09-09T14:18:56Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/b8886915-14cb-44df-86fa-7ab718acf49a">     <title>Pike fecundity data 1963-2002</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/b8886915-14cb-44df-86fa-7ab718acf49a</link>     <description>This dataset consists of fecundity (number of eggs) data on Pike (Esox lucius) from net sampling in Windermere. Data collection began in 1963. The data were initially collected by the Freshwater Biological Association (FBA) but have been collected by CEH and its predecessor Institute of Freshwater Ecology (IFE) since 1989.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Claire Wood</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Windermere</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-09-09T13:57:07Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/b1540d75-bbec-4181-902f-f0b43eeee359">     <title>Environmental Change Network (ECN) monitoring sites view service</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/b1540d75-bbec-4181-902f-f0b43eeee359</link>     <description>This service provides a view of Environmental Change Network (ECN) site locations from which data are collected.  There are 12 terrestrial sites and 45 freshwater sites. Sites range from upland to lowland, moor land to chalk grassland, small ponds and streams to large rivers and lakes.  ECN is the UK's long-term environmental monitoring programme. A wide range of integrated physical, chemical and biological variables which drive and respond to environmental change are collated, quality controlled and made freely available for scientific research. The data form an important evidence base for UK environmental policy development.  ECN is a multi-agency programme sponsored by a consortium of fourteen government departments and agencies. These organisations contribute to the programme through funding either site monitoring and/or network co-ordination activities.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Philip Trembath</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Biodiversity Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Biogeochemistry Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>infoMapAccessService</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Environmental Change Network</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>ECN</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>LTER</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>ILTER</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-08-22T15:46:24Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/c53a1f93-f64c-4d84-82a7-44038a394c59">     <title>Conwy catchment - spatial water chemistry dataset</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/c53a1f93-f64c-4d84-82a7-44038a394c59</link>     <description>Surface water quality data for the Conwy catchment, North Wales are presented. The data cover stream and estuary survey locations sampled manually from 2007 to 2011 at varying intervals between fortnightly and quarterly. Survey locations were selected as draining the main landscape classes in the catchment, which include upland (>300m) and lowland (<300m) environments under trees, moorland or improved agriculture. Also included are a suite of locations on the major rivers, and in the estuary. The purpose of the data is to provide support for estimating loads and testing hypotheses relating to the relationship between subcatchment properties and water quality, and the relative importance of mixing and in-stream processes in influencing downstream water quality.   Streams draining peat, with high dissolved organic carbon concentrations, are well represented.  Upland drainage is generally acidic, and lowland circum-neutral. The lowland rivers are not heavily contaminated with nutrients, although they show evidence of some loss of nitrates in particular. There is little industry in the catchment beyond agriculture and tourism, though there is some legacy contamination from metal mines in a small part of the catchment.  Measurements are provided for major cations and anions, pH, alkalinity, DOC, Al, Fe and conductivity for most samples, with values for a wide range of trace elements for a limited number of samples.  </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Dan Wright</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>hydrochemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>water quality</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Conwy Catchment</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Wales</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>UK</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>river</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>stream</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>lake</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>weekly</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>quarterly</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Project NEC0454</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-07-26T09:21:58Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/b7cfc0ce-304a-4d69-bb1a-6fd8eb92cdae">     <title>Rainfall, throughfall and stemflow for Beech and Ash stands in temperate English deciduous woodlands</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/b7cfc0ce-304a-4d69-bb1a-6fd8eb92cdae</link>     <description>Water quality data produced from rainfall, throughfall and stemflow samples collected within a beech stand at Black Wood in Hampshire, and an ash stand at Old Pond Close in Northamptonshire. Two studies were carried out in the early 1990s to examine water quality in relation to hydrological and pollution changes. Chemical analysis involved a combination of electrometric (pH), inductively-coupled plasma emission spectroscopy (most major, minor and trace elements), atomic absorption spectroscopy (potassium), ion chromatography (major anions and fluorine) and colourimetry (ammonium and silicon).</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Jacky Chaplow</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Analytical chemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Hydrochemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>hydrology</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>water quality</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>River</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>rain</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>rainfall</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>throughfall</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>stemflow</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>1990</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>1991</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>1992</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-06-06T08:23:30Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/5609a35a-c360-4125-b122-1fa1475e0e2d">     <title>River Carnon. Wheal Jane Mine hydrochemistry data</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/5609a35a-c360-4125-b122-1fa1475e0e2d</link>     <description>Trace metal mobilisation data (pH, ALK, Na, K, Ca, Mg, Li, SO4, Si, Be, Mn, Fe, Zn, Cu, Al,Sr, Be, Ba, Y,Co, Ni, B, Rb, Y, Cd, Sb, Cs, Ba, La, Ce, Nd, Pb, Th, U) for the River Carnon, the River Fal (downstream) and its estuary in Cornwall following discharge of highly polluted water from the Wheal Jane mine. In January 1992, there was a major pollution incident involving highly acidic wastes. CEH, in conjunction with the University of Reading monitored the River Carnon between September 1992 and April 1994, to examine the water quality. </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Jacky Chaplow</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Analytical chemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Hydrochemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Aluminium</dc:subject> <dc:subject>Be</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Mn</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Fe</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Zn</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Cu</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Al</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Sr</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Be</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Ba</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Y</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Co</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Ni</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>B</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Rb</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Y</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Cd</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Sb</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Cs</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Ba</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>La</dc:subject> rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/e0588fab-be15-4948-a946-75ad469d7a63">     <title>Spring and surface water quality of Cyprus ophiolites</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/e0588fab-be15-4948-a946-75ad469d7a63</link>     <description>This dataset provides the results of a water quality survey undertaken in mid-May 1985 of streams, springs and boreholes associated with the ophiolite rocks of the Troodos Massif in Cyprus. The survey links to a study of the chemical evolution of surface and near-surface waters within ultrabasic rock terrains. Details of the rationale to the study, sample locations, water types, chemical analysis, findings and conclusions are provided within Neal and Shand, 2002. This paper requires citing when using the data. </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Jacky Chaplow</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Streams</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>springs</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>borehole</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>waters</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Cyprus</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Mediterranean</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Analytical chemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Hydrochemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-05-22T10:58:27Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     </rdf:RDF>
